critique: This document is an executive order transferring funds from one agency to another during the Great Depression. It is difficult to assess its ideological tilt without more context, but the fact that it is part of the New Deal suggests a liberal approach. The order does not directly address immigration, executive power, federalism, national security, economic regulation, or social inclusion. However, the transfer of funds to the Federal Emergency Relief Administration suggests government intervention in the economy. Therefore, I will assign a score of 3 for economic regulation. Since the document appropriates money, it could be argued that it expands executive power, but I will assign it a 0 since it is simply exercising existing authority. The document does not directly address the other axes, so I will assign them a score of 0.
